Global_Payroll_Integration_EventObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Global_Payroll_Integration_EventObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Global_Payroll_Integration_EventObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Pay_GroupObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Pay_GroupObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Pay_GroupObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: Pay Group is required when integration system template is of type Payroll Effective Change Interface.

Integration_Event_Error_Message_Set_Data.description: Set the flag to true only if the payroll processing for the provided pay group was completed successfully.

Integration_Event_Error_Message_Worker_D.description: A boolean to specify whether the error data provided is related to a person or a foundational object.Setting the boolean to true enforces the field Worker_Reference to be required.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Integration_Event_Error_Message_Worker_D.description: An optional description of the foundational object type in which the error is tied to (Organization, Compensation Plan, ...)

Payroll_Integration_Event_Error_Message_.description: The type of the error being recorded.
A text representation of the message category where the error occurred, example: Worker Data, Organization, Supervisory, Staffing...
The functional area that was impacted by this error reported, example: Position, Compensation, Personal data...

Background_Process_Message_Severity_Leve.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.
Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Payroll_Integration_Event_Error_Message_.description: A reference to a severity level type, example: Critical, Error, Warning...
An integer number identifying the error reported.
A required detailed error message, explaining what problems occurred for that worker while processing that record.
An explanation of why the error occurred.
A procedure is the required steps needed to be taken in order to overcome that error raised.
List the names, positions, or roles of the concerned audience for handling the error resolution.

Payroll_Integration_Event_Message_Data_G.description: The category of the group holding the data to be provided, example: Allowance, Address...
A more specific name of the type of data being provided, example: Car Allowance, Home Address...
The name of the field attribute being reported, example: Amount, Currency, Status...
The value of the field attribute being reported, example: 2000, USD, Active
A group of attribute data supplementing the group data

Payroll_Integration_Event_Error_Message_.description: A group of optional data supplementing the main error being reported (Additional information)

Integration_Event_Error_Message_Worker_D.description: A data set containing a group of errors and exceptions concerning an individual worker for a specific integration run and pay group

Integration_Event_Error_Message_Set_Data.description: A section where all the worker related errors to be reported for a certain Integration Event and Pay Group can be grouped together

validation.validation: Unable to save the data provided, the dependent fields "Is_Worker_Data" and "Worker_Reference" are not set properly, please provide values for both fields.

description: A container holding all the data to be reported to Workday that share the same integration event and pay group

validation.validation: Unable to process the data provided, please provide (only one) of the sections "Is_Successful" or "Integration Event Error Message Worker Data"
